selected_quotes: Sometimes you need to use repellent differently when traveling to #dengue regions compared to elsewhere in Australia.
As locally acquired cases of #dengue increase, what advice should be given to FNQ bound travellers? #health
Here is paper describing mosquito repellent use in tropical/temperate regions @tea_n_toasted @beebearninja
Important to raise awareness of differences in mosquito-borne disease risk between tropical and temperate regions

citation.abstract: Dengue outbreaks occur annually in Far North Queensland, Australia. Advice on topical insect repellents provided by health authorities rarely addresses the wide range of formulations and active ingredients currently registered for use in Australia. Recommendations on the use of registered products require review.
citation.title: Advice to Travelers on Topical Insect Repellent Use Against Dengue Mosquitoes in Far North Queensland, Australia

blogs.title: Should we mix mosquito repellents and sunscreens?
blogs.summary:
Combining mosquito repellents with sunscreens, as well as other cosmetics, sounds like a great idea but perhaps it isn’t to best way to protect ourselves from exposure to both the sun and mosquitoes.
